metadata.Title: CVE-2021-40211 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered with ImageMagick 7.1.0-4 via Division by zero infunction ReadEnhMetaFile of coders/emf.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-40211` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm4
imagemagick-6.q16 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm4
imagemagick-common - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm4
libimage-magick-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm4
libimage-magick-q16-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm4
libmagick++-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm4
libmagick++-6.q16-5v5 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm4
libmagickcore-6-arch-config - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm4
libmagickcore-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm4
libmagickcore-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm4
libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm4
libmagickwand-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm4
libmagickwand-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm4
perlmagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm4').
